Description: Papyrus (mounted in three frames) written with black ink with demotic legal text on recto (11 ll.) and names of 16 witnesses on verso. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Assignment of one-third share of an extensive amount of property in temple offices and liturgies, houses and land, made by Petetumis son of Twot the younger to his son Tef-Hap and guaranteed by the latter's elder half-brother Twot, to whom his father had already assigned the other two-thirds of the property. Date. year 25 Paophi 25 of Ptolemy Epiphanes = BC. 181 Nov. 30". Nos. 10575-10601 from the Siut Archive.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (43351) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/43351)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fractured, lifting, delaminating, deposit, creased, turnovers Black ink (abraded) Tabbed: kraft paper Tabbed: silk Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: cloth (damaged) Object Priority: B Mount Priority: B Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair
